{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3396303,"name":"Tanya Vyshegorodtseva","username":"Toefty","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/8e7dd6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-07T13:57:12.508Z","cooked":"

Hey, everyone! This past season was our team‚Äôs first year with swerve and to make writing autonomous easier, I, as the lead programmer, have set up and figured out PathPlanner. The season came to an end and I have graduated, but I want the team to be even better next season, so I have been researching other options. And another popular software people use is Choreo. And I know both PathPlanner and Choreo can be used together. So, the ultimate question is what is better? PathPlanner or Choreo? Does one have certain advantages the other doesn‚Äôt? Are they both used in different situations? It seemed to me that PathPlanner is more simple and user-friendly (maybe better for our new young programmer next year), while Choreo is more complex and more adjustable (might yield more accurate auton‚Äôs). What are everyone‚Äôs thoughts/experiences?
Thank you, in advance!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-07T14:41:03.560Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1333,"reads":771,"readers_count":770,"score":6814.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":467373,"topic_slug":"choreo-vs-pathplanner","display_username":"Tanya Vyshegorodtseva","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54258,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/choreo-vs-pathplanner/467373/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3396346,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-07T14:55:37.716Z","cooked":"

How reliable have you made your autos with PathPlanner? Generally the Choreo team recommends that if you‚Äôve previously used PathPlanner and can‚Äôt get it to drive even slow paths accurately (well within physical limits), Choreo will not be helpful. If your troubles with PathPlanner were only evident when trying to speed up the paths, you probably have your path following logic working correctly, and Choreo will help you avoid the limitations of PathPlanner.

The main difference between Choreo and PathPlanner in practice is that Choreo accounts for the physical limits of the robot and creates the lowest-time path that fits within them. With PathPlanner it‚Äôs up to you to limit the robot speed and acceleration, with comparatively coarse controls.

Also do note that Choreo trajectories can be loaded and followed with PathPlannerLib with effectively no code changes.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-07T14:55:37.716Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":21,"reads":737,"readers_count":736,"score":407.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467373,"topic_slug":"choreo-vs-pathplanner","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/choreo-vs-pathplanner/467373/2","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3396347,"name":"Oliver | 1986","username":"Oliver_W","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oliver_w/{size}/231411_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-07T14:56:36.553Z","cooked":"

My team personally didn‚Äôt use Choreo last year due to it being our first year on Java, and path planning at all, and running out of time. However, we have heard great things and we are planning on using it next year. I am still trying to figure out if I wanna use both or just Choreo, however, I am most likely going to use both. I know Choreo is still early in development, but they are adding features very quickly so using both may not be necessary next year.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-07T14:56:36.553Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":684,"readers_count":683,"score":206.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467373,"topic_slug":"choreo-vs-pathplanner","display_username":"Oliver | 1986","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1986 Driver | MoSim Co-Developer"},"post_url":"/t/choreo-vs-pathplanner/467373/3","custom_user_title":"1986 Driver | MoSim Co-Developer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3396393,"name":"Tanya Vyshegorodtseva","username":"Toefty","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/8e7dd6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-07T17:06:57.746Z","cooked":"

I did get the autos to work pretty accurately with PathPlanner, but I had to do a lot of adjustments and fine tuning.
I did see that Choreo has a lot of settings for the robot‚Äôs characteristics, such as weight and moment of inertia, which made me think it accounts for it in the paths.
Thanks for the insights!

What we decided to do is use both. Creating the paths in choreo and making the autos and path following with PP.

Personaly i prefer creating paths in choreo more than using PP.

Choreo does use these characteristics in its backend. I do not know everything that goes into it, but I know it considers those characteristics for all the math.

GitHub

GitHub - SleipnirGroup/TrajoptLib: Library for generating time-optimal...

Library for generating time-optimal trajectories for FRC robots. Used by the HelixNavigator path planning app. - SleipnirGroup/TrajoptLib

Used by the HelixNavigator path planning app.","clicks":30}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54258,"username":"Toefty","name":"Tanya Vyshegorodtseva","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/8e7dd6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1986 Driver | MoSim Co-Developer"},"post_url":"/t/choreo-vs-pathplanner/467373/8","custom_user_title":"1986 Driver | MoSim Co-Developer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3396494,"name":"","username":"AbuGatti","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/4af34b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-07T21:16:21.270Z","cooked":"

I would recommend starting with pathplanner, get familiar with everything and make some autonomous routines with it. After that, switching to Choreo isn‚Äôt much effort. My team started with pathplanner this season, we looked into Choreo midseason, it was pretty easy to change our code to work with Choreo but we ended up staying with pathplanner because it was just easier to develop on. We had a consistent 5 note auto using Pathplanner so you won‚Äôt be missing out by not using Choreo.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-07T21:16:53.163Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":454,"readers_count":453,"score":130.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467373,"topic_slug":"choreo-vs-pathplanner","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38509,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/choreo-vs-pathplanner/467373/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3396511,"name":"Tanya Vyshegorodtseva","username":"Toefty","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/8e7dd6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-07T23:46:44.508Z","cooked":"

Yeah, that‚Äôs pretty much the route I imagined. I got a consistent 4-piece auton with PathPlanner, which is already much better than anything we had in the past. But I was hoping to improve even more and thought that maybe Choreo might give more possibilities. But with our new programmer, it might be better to get him familiar with PathPlanner since it‚Äôs easier and then see whether he is willing to switch to Choreo.

How did you do that? I tried using it the same way, but I couldn‚Äôt succeed.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-11-04T13:37:32.500Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":70.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467373,"topic_slug":"choreo-vs-pathplanner","display_username":"Daniel Cipriani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":54481,"username":"Kully","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kully/{size}/264955_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65929,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"BugSlayer"},"post_url":"/t/choreo-vs-pathplanner/467373/12","custom_user_title":"BugSlayer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3443481,"name":"","username":"Kully","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kully/{size}/264955_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-04T14:08:28.364Z","cooked":"

You can create the path in choreo just regularly(you can check the docs)

And in PP when creating an auto it gives you the option to choose between pp auto or choreo auto so choose choreo

Otherwise if you just want to run 1 choreo path from the code and not create an auto configre PP like usual and you can get the choreo path as a PP path using this line

PathPlannerPath.fromChoreoTrajectory(‚ÄúChoreoTraj‚Äù);

Than just run it like a usual PP path
